intro: Bocquillonia corneri, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
